intro: Homalium lanceolatum, commonly known as the lanceleaf huito, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Mexico and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered yellow flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and shrublands. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its ecological role in seed dispersal.
